executive_summary: Demand for the Paintball Fields industry has declined over the five years to 2021. Consumer interest in paintball as both a sport and hobby has been waning in recent years, since a substantial peak in 2016. Moreover, the substantial upfront and continual costs associated with paintball equipment purchases has deterred consumers from engaging in the activity. These trends have contributed to consistent revenue decline for much of the five-year period and have been amplified by the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. Overall, total revenue has decreased at an annualized rate of 0.3% to $1.3 billion over the five years to 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Closures experienced at the outbreak of the event
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Still, affordability of services has been a major deterrent to immediate recovery. Substantial costs associated with equipment purchases and recurring expenses of field admissions have prevented many consumers from returning to the hobby. This dynamic has been a major contributing factor to industry decline over the past five years and was only amplified by the pandemic's recessionary environment.

A main contributing factor to paintball's waning interest as a hobby is the substantial upfront costs associated with purchasing equipment, along with continued costs of ammo and field admissions. According to the website TheHobbyKraze.com, the lowest-end paintball guns typically cost between $100.00 to $150.00, while the highest-end models can cost upward of $2,000.

Paintball's popularity peaked in 2016 as participation in paintball increased 9.5% in 2016, according to a survey conducted by the Outdoor Industry Association. Following several years of marginal growth in participation, the jump in participation levels boosted industry activity. In particular, the industry expanded with the entrance of new industry operators and the expansion of new fields by incumbents.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry participation has decreased as revenue has declined.
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The number of competing enterprises has declined at an annualized rate of 0.7% to 1,695 companies over the five years to 2021. Industry exit has been a function of lackluster demand coupled with the substantial amount of fixed costs related to maintaining a paintball field. Operators purchase real estate that typically spans multiple acres, which requires constant maintenance to be presentable.

Overall, industry revenue is forecast to increase at an annualized rate of 0.8% to reach $1.3 billion in 2026. Broad economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic will characterize a large majority of domestic industries over the five years to 2026. Paintball fields will benefit from rising consumer confidence, expansion in disposable income levels and increased consumer spending.

The adolescent population (consumers aged 10 to 19) is expected to contract an annualized 0.1% over the five years to 2026. Although such a decline is marginal, the Paintball Fields industry is particularly dependent on this demographic. IBISWorld estimates consumers under age 18 account for 57.4% of industry revenue, representing the industry's largest market.

industry_definition: This industry includes establishments that provide recreational paintball and other amusement services. Paintball is a sport in which players compete, either in teams or individually, to eliminate opponents by hitting them with
key_trends: The affordability of industry services has been severely affected by the coronavirus pandemic
Following several years of marginal participation growth, increased participation levels boosted industry activity
Industry exit has been a function of lack luster demand coupled with the substantial amount of fixed costs
The industry will have to contend with external industries for consumer interest
The industry is expected to benefit from a forecast increase in sports participation levels
Contraction of value-added services is expected to affect industry profitability
Affordability of industry services has been a major deterrent to immediate recovery following the pandemic

market_segmentation.segment_description: Adolescents and teenagers comprise the largest market for paintball fields, accounting for an estimated 57.4% of industry revenue in 2021. This demographic typically has the most available leisure time, is highly active and is most commonly attracted to the industry's high-intensity, combat-themed action.

Teenagers, young professional adults and middle-aged adults also generate a substantial portion of sales for the industry, accounting for an estimated 37.6% of total industry revenue in 2021. The younger half of this market segment is a coveted demographic to which paintball goods, services and apparel are most commonly marketed and sold.

Teenagers, young professional adults and middle-aged adults also generate a substantial portion of sales for the industry, accounting for an estimated 37.6% of total industry revenue in 2021. Older consumers in this segment may also possess greater disposable income to spend and may also have children who want to come to the industry's paintball fields.

Teenagers, young professional adults and middle-aged adults also generate a substantial portion of sales for the industry, accounting for an estimated 37.6% of total industry revenue in 2021. Older consumers in this segment may also possess greater disposable income to spend and may also have children who want to come to the industry's paintball fields.
Consumers aged 40 and older account for a marginal share of industry revenue. IBISWorld estimates consumers aged 40 and older to account for 5.0% of industry revenue in 2021.

products_and_services.product_description: Woodsball, also called recball, bushball or hillball, is a form of paintball that is generally played in a forested area; however, it can also be played in any natural environment or large, open field.

Scenario paintball represents the most common industry field type and captures an estimated 36.9% of revenue in 2021. Scenario paintball generally requires a basic theme and consists of the reenactment of historical battles or a storyline behind the match for realistic situations and objectives.

Speedball is representative of the most regulated variant of paintball, usually employing a referee and a strict set of guidelines. Speedball is generally played in netted arenas with air-filled bunkers of different shapes and sizes for protection.

Indoor paintball games and services are estimated to account for 2.8% of industry revenue in 2021. Companies in the industry often have stores or pro shops that sell and rent paintball-related products and provide paintball equipment repair services.

tier_1_suppliers: Sporting Goods Wholesaling in the US
Janitorial Equipment Supply Wholesaling in the US
Hobby & Toy Stores in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Property, Casualty and Direct Insurance in the US
Tax Preparation Services in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumers are more likely to take up paintball as a hobby or as a casual recreational activity when their disposable income increases.
Increased emphasis on health-related activities serves as an encouraging factor related to increased demand for paintball fields.
As the availability of leisure time increases among the general public, demand for recreational activities like paintball will increase.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Interest in Paintball as a Sport
demand_determinants.determinant_description: General interest and popularity of paintball as a sport influences demand for paintball fields.
Growth in the number of adolescents aged 10 to 19 has the potential to increase demand for industry services, since this age group makes up over half of all paintball players.
Changes in the cost of substitute recreational activities like airsoft can affect demand for paintball fields.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Paintball Fields industry is service-based; therefore, the import of goods does not occur within the industry.
The Paintball Fields industry is service-based; therefore, the export of goods does not occur within the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The regions that hold the greatest number of establishments include the Southeast (27.8% of establishments).
The regions that hold the greatest number of establishments include the West (13.5%).
The regions that hold the greatest number of establishments include the Mid-Atlantic (13.2%).

regulations_points.regulation_description: Generally, all states ban the use of paintball guns in a manner other than their intended purpose or outside a sanctioned field. Some states, including Illinois, New Hampshire and Rhode Island regulate sales and possession of paintball guns by minors.

There are also rules within games that are specific to the paintball game. However, most industry operators require that players sign waivers, wear protective gear, regulate player gun speed and listen to the referees for safety.

Additionally, the industry must take the proper steps to adhere to environmental regulation. Nearly all paintballs are biodegradable, and all ingredients used to make a paintball are food-grade quality and harmless to the participants and to the environment.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Obtaining capital to purchase/rent land, indoor facilities require higher investment for air conditioning/utilities, liability insurance is a significant cost, lawsuits are common despite waivers.
Outdoor facilities may not require high investment, leasing provides lower-cost alternative, new facilities can open in less populated areas with lower costs.
Restrictive zoning laws, lengthy permit processes, shortage of appropriate real estate. However, successful establishments must be close to other entertainment facilities where rent can be high.

factors_increased_barrier: Obtaining necessary capital to purchase or rent land
Indoor facilities require additional investment for air conditioning, heating, electricity and plumbing
Liability insurance is a significant cost
Lawsuits are common despite waiver agreements with customers
factors_decreased_barrier: Outdoor facilities may not require as high initial investment
Leasing operations provide a relatively lower-cost alternative for entry
New facilities can open in less populated areas with lower rental and building costs

basis_points.basis_description: Industry participants compete on type of paintball field, field location, customer service and price offerings for rates and gear rental. Experienced players require more expensive specialized markers than casual players. Operators with pro shops generate additional revenue and remain more competitive.

Comparable forms of alternative entertainment like movies, amusement parks, concerts, sporting events, video games, outdoor sports represent external competition. The industry also competes with recreational industries like golf courses, ski facilities, fitness centers, bowling alleys.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is highly fragmented with the two largest enterprises commanding less than 5% market share in 2021. Low barriers to entry and absence of substantial enterprises contribute to fragmentation.
The average operator employs less than 10 individuals, underlining the abundance of small-scale enterprises as opposed to large national competitors.
Market concentration has slightly increased over 5 years to 2021 as total number of enterprises has declined, but localized small operators prevent substantial increase.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage costs represent the largest industry expense category, accounting for an estimated 27.9% of average revenue in 2021. While paintball fields require fairly substantial upfront investments in real estate, terrain, equipment and facilities, core function is heavily reliant on labor.

Purchases represent a significant portion of the industry's expenses, accounting for an estimated 5.3% of industry revenue. Depending on the type of facility and location, industry operators will experience differing costs.

The Paintball Fields industry is moderately capital intensive. Industry entrance requires significant upfront capital expenditure in the form of real estate, facilities, terrain, office locations and relative utilities.

Paintball fields compete in highly localized geographic markets, since no substantial national enterprise exists in the industry. As a result, management regularly invests in marketing and advertisement campaigns to attract new guests and generate revenue.
Rent costs are substantial for industry operators since the size, scale, geographic location and complexity of paintball fields is a major selling point for attracting guests.
Utility costs are related to general sewage, plumbing and electricity expenses for owned or leased locations.
Other costs include depreciation, marketing, insurance, legal expenses and other miscellaneous administrative costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Capital expenditures are generally associated with upfront costs upon entering the industry. Paintball fields require real estate purchases, purchased materials for constructed terrain.
Paintball fields are also highly labor intensive, with the average establishment maintaining 9 or more employees.
Capital intensity has declined over the five years to 2021. In 2016, the average competing enterprise allocated $0.30 toward capital expenditures per $1.00 in labor expense.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Industry demand is primarily related to consumer spending trends, per capita disposable income levels, time spent.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Although the industry as a whole does not undergo rapid technological change, equipment used during matches has simultaneously improved and declined in price.

For example, typical paintball chest protectors have been quickly evolving over the past five years. Paintball chest protectors that had once been commonly made out of hard material worn over a shirt have now evolved to include thin layers capable of fitting comfortably underneath clothing.

FAQs.question: Does seasonality affect sales for the products and services your company offers?
FAQs.answer: Some paintball fields close in the winter. Adverse weather conditions will likely result in closed paintball fields.

FAQs.question: Do demographic changes have an effect on company sales?
FAQs.answer: This industry relies heavily on males under 18. Young males represent this industry's largest market.

FAQs.question: Do you reduce wage costs through seasonal employment?
FAQs.answer: Wage costs represent about one-quarter of total revenue.

FAQs.question: If your company benefits from population density, are you located in high traffic areas to increase your exposure?
FAQs.answer: Most paintball fields are located in the suburbs or just outside of them. Larger fields are located close to interstates in remote areas.

FAQs.question: Has your company integrated web and mobile reservation and appointment systems to improve consumer accessibility?
FAQs.answer: Some indoor facilities allow for reservations. Companies operating multiple fields may offer appointment systems.

FAQs.question: Has your company updated facilities in order to enhance the consumer experience?
FAQs.answer: Some paintball fields build field obstacles and bunkers. Scenario paintball fields will often add military props in an effort to enhance the consumer experience.

FAQs.question: Do you offer membership agreements, tickets or passes that may be subject to state or federal regulation?
FAQs.answer: Some paintball fields sell tickets for large-scale games. Membership agreements and ticket sales are subject to very minimal state regulation (typically regarding the unlawfulness of discriminatory practices) and no federal regulation.

FAQs.question: How frequently does your company require federal and state approval for capital improvements?
FAQs.answer: State and federal approval is not required. Compliance is not a major factor for this industry.

FAQs.question: Do you develop off-season demand through alternative products and services in order to maintain a steady cash flow during slower seasons?
FAQs.answer: Some paintball fields stay open in the winter to sell paintball gear. There are not many opportunities to develop cash flow during slow seasons.

FAQs.question: Does your company have to purchase new equipment on an annual basis?
FAQs.answer: Paintball fields rent out paintball gear, and this gear needs to be updated every several years. Customers like to use the latest paintball guns available.

FAQs.question: Are your hours of operation convenient for clients? Are night and weekend services available?
FAQs.answer: A high profile location offering easy access and parking will drive consumer demand.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company by word-of-mouth recommendations? How do you attract support from local patrons?
FAQs.answer: Attracting the support of competitive and casual players is crucial, and generating repeat customers will ensure steady flow of revenue.

FAQs.question: How successful have you been in operating your business? How can you improve the business expertise of your managers?
FAQs.answer: Companies in the industry must have skills in operating a business profitably, since there are a variety of other entertainment options available to consumers.

FAQs.question: Do you track the number of adolescents in the regions you serve? How do you make sure your establishments appeal to adolescents?
FAQs.answer: Since a significant portion of the industry's clients are teenagers, minimal growth in the number of citizens within this market segment will contribute to a decrease in customer base.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor changes in per capita disposable income?
FAQs.answer: The success of paintball fields highly depends on revenue generated from consumers with additional cash on hand; periods of economic decline often cause consumers to immediately refrain from nonessential leisure activities such as paintball.

FAQs.question: How is your establishment affected when consumer confidence is low? How can you stimulate demand during times of low consumer confidence?
FAQs.answer: The industry relies on consumer behavior patterns that encourage spending on discretionary goods instead of saving. Higher levels of consumer confidence support increased demand for industry services.
